Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, slightly ribbed, interior smeared with traces of a black resinous substance, with remains of at least five lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the exterior, containing an invoice.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.150)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87670) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87670)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 190 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
